report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.06.0]
**INSTITUTION EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT PATIENT NAME: **NAME[AAA, BBB] ACCOUNT #: **ID-NUM DATE OF SERVICE: **DATE[May 14 06] PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN: **NAME[TTT] **NAME[SSS] HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: CHIEF COMPLAINT: Abdominal pain. HPI: The patient is a **AGE[in 40s]-year-old female with a history of schizophrenia, mild MR, and constipation who presents today reporting constipation. She states she has not had a bowel movement in three to four days. She denies dysuria, hematuria, fevers, nausea and vomiting. She denies abdominal distention. REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Negative for chest pain, dyspnea, hematochezia, and back pain. PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: 1. Schizophrenia. 2. Mild MR. 3. Osteoarthritis. 4. Status post cholecystectomy. 5. Seizures. 6. Constipation. MEDICATIONS: 1. Lamictal. 2. Cogentin. 3. Risperdal. 4. Ativan. 5. Prevacid. ALLERGIES: NONE. SOCIAL HISTORY: The patient denies tobacco and alcohol use. PHYSICAL EXAM: Vitals: Temperature 35.6, heart rate 98, respirations 18, blood pressure 120/73. GENERAL: Well-developed, well-nourished female in no acute distress. HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Mucous membranes moist. No oropharyngeal lesions. NECK: Supple. Full range of motion. No meningismus. CARDIAC: Normal rate, regular rhythm. No murmur, rubs, or gallops. ABDOMEN: Nontender, nondistended, normal active bowel sounds. EXTREMITIES: No lower extremity edema. LUNGS: Clear to auscultation bilaterally without crackles or wheezes. ED COURSE: The patient received a Fleets enema and a GI cocktail. The patient did have a bowel movement and reports that her abdominal pain did resolve. She stated that she felt better, and she felt that she was stable for discharge. The patient was also given a GI cocktail and was discharged home with instruction to follow up with her primary care physician as needed. MEDICAL DECISION-MAKING: The patient is a **AGE[in 40s]-year-old female well known to the Emergency Department who presents regularly with constipation. The patient did improve after moving her bowels and denies all other associated symptoms. I do not suspect acute intraabdominal pathology. DIAGNOSIS(ES): CONSTIPATION. DISPOSITION: Discharged home in stable medical condition. ___________________________________ **NAME[YYY M. ZZZ], M.D.
Dictator: **NAME[WWW M. XXX], M.D. **INITIALS D: **DATE[May 14 2007] 12:08:32 T: **DATE[May 14 2007] 12:36:19 R: **DATE[May 14 2007] 12:36:19/kll Job ID: 346132/**ID-NUM Cc:
*** Dictated By: -**NAME[XXX, RRR M]. *** Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ] **DATE[May 16 2007] 07:44:49 PM
